name: Metformin + IV Contrast — Lactic Acidosis Risk
description: 72-year-old female with type 2 diabetes on Metformin, admitted for CT angiography with IV contrast. Mild baseline renal impairment (CKD Stage 2). Post-contrast nephropathy develops, threatening Metformin accumulation and lactic acidosis.

steps.narrative: Pre-contrast baseline. Mild CKD Stage 2. Static system flags Metformin-contrast interaction. Context-aware: low risk, mild baseline impairment is stable.
Contrast administered 2 hours ago. No change yet. Monitoring.
Creatinine rising post-contrast. Early contrast-induced nephropathy. Context-aware notes informational alert.
Significant contrast nephropathy. Metformin clearance compromised. WARNING — hold Metformin, check lactate.
CRITICAL. GFR <30. High risk of metformin-associated lactic acidosis. Immediate intervention required.
